meanings.sent1: The garden was infested with grubs, tiny beetle larvae.
meanings.sent2: The farmer found grubs in the soil while planting his crops.
meanings.sent3: The grubs were having a party underground, munching on roots.
meanings.sent4: The grubs wriggled like tiny dancers in the soil.
meanings.sent5: The grubs squirmed and wiggled, eager to become beetles one day.

meanings.definition: To dig or search for something in the ground, especially for food
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel grubs for acorns in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The dog grubs in the backyard looking for buried bones.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa grubs in the garden, searching for his lost keys.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist grubs carefully in the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The kids love to grub in the sand at the beach, searching for treasures.

meanings.definition: A person who does menial work
meanings.sent1: The grubs at the construction site worked hard all day.
meanings.sent2: The young man started as a grub, sweeping floors at the office.
meanings.sent3: The office manager jokingly called himself the 'chief grub'.
meanings.sent4: The grubs in the kitchen tirelessly washed dishes and cleaned.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was excited to prove himself as a valuable grub.

meanings.definition: To eat food greedily or without manners
meanings.sent1: The hungry child grubs down his meal in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The raccoon grubs on the leftovers left in the trash can.
meanings.sent3: The guests at the party started to grub on the buffet as soon as it was served.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside the window grubbed on the seeds in the feeder.
meanings.sent5: The teenager would always grub on snacks while watching TV in the evening.
